citations.narrative:
In a back holding room, there is one enclosure housing 11 spiny mice with injuries to their tails. Several of the mice have
abrasions along the length of their tails that are reddened and scabbed. According to the licensee, animals are typically
separated into smaller groups when there is evidence of compatibility issues, though this had not been done recently.
Housing incompatible animals together can lead to injury or even death. The facility must ensure that animals housed
together are compatible. CORRECT BY: 6/9/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.133 
   
Separation. 
In a back holding room, there is one enclosure housing 11 spiny mice with injuries to their tails. Several of the mice have 
abrasions along the length of their tails that are reddened and scabbed. According to the licensee, animals are typically 
separated into smaller groups when there is evidence of compatibility issues, though this had not been done recently. 
Housing incompatible animals together can lead to injury or even death. The facility must ensure that animals housed 
together are compatible. CORRECT BY: 6/9/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
 n
